Postings.Text: ARTICLE - Greipel sprint train delivers victory
VIDEO - Down Under Classic wrap up by Phil Liggett and Paul Sherwen

2012 DOWN UNDER CLASSIC: OFFICIAL RESULTS. 1:Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB 2:Adam Hansen (AUS) - LTB 3:35 4:Jose Joaquin Rojas (ESP) - MOV 5:Steele von Hoff (AUS - Vic) - UNA 6:Jonathan Cantwell (AUS) - SAX 7:Christopher Sutton (AUS) - SKY 8:Jose Ivan Gutierrez (ESP) - MOV 9:Gregory Henderson (NZL) - LTB 10:Alessandro Petacchi (ITA) - LAM selected placings: 15:Robbie McEwen (AUS) - GEC 120:Mark Renshaw (AUS) - RAB. Non finishers: Cameron Meyer (AUS) - GEC, Danny Pate (USA) - SKY, Jacopo Guarnieri (ITA) - AST, Kenny van Hummel (NED) - VCD. Non starter: Luke Durbridge (AUS) - GEC. Prime sprint winners: Lap 5: Jose Ivan Gutierrez (ESP) - MOV, Lap 10: Nathan Haas (AUS) - GRM, Lap 15: Nathan Haas (AUS) - GRM, Lap 20: Nathan Haas (AUS) - GRM. Average race speed: 48.4km/h. Race time: 1:03:17.

Two times SANTOS Tour Down Under winner Andre Greipel is now a two times Down Under Classic winner after a dominating victory in Adelaide's East End. The 2008 and 2010 champion enjoyed a perfect lead-out from his LOTTO-BELISOL team-mates to win by several bike lengths from another cycling superstar Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY and Aussie Heinrich Haussler (AUS) - GRM. Four Aussies finished in the top ten with Steele von Hoff (AUS - Vic) - UNA (5th), Jonathan Cantwell (AUS) - SAX (6th) and Christopher Sutton (AUS) - SKY (7th) all making a bid for glory but no one had the power to match Greipel. Classic favourite Mark Renshaw (AUS) - RAB couldn't replicate his pre-race optimism and faded well before the finale. The furious race pace didn't stop the exciting Nathan Haas (AUS) - GRM making it a great night for the Garmin-Barracuda team with three Prime sprint victories. After Jose Ivan Gutierrez (ESP) - MOV claimed the first 500 Euros/$620 AUS on offer at the end of lap 5, Haas cleaned up the rest. Part of a nine rider break that enjoyed some "TV time" for a majority of the race, Haas timed his charge perfectly at the end of laps 10, 15 and 20 to claim a total of 1500 Euros/approx $1860 AUS for the team kitty. In his first World Tour race this was a stunning performance and a sure sign of things to come. But after the final prime the break was swallowed up and the teams got to work preparing their men for the final dash for glory. LOTTO-BELISOL was always lurking with SKY, LAMPRE, RABOBANK, GreenEDGE and GARMIN-BARRACUDA jostling to control the race but the high tempo made this task almost impossible. By the final bend Greipel's men had complete control with Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY making an early attack to try and derail the LOTTO-BELISOL train. But as history has shown us in January, Greipel is a force of nature, and when he made his move it was all over. He'll go into Tuesday's first stage of the SANTOS Tour Down Under full of confidence, and the rest of the field well aware that although this Tour may not favour the sprinters, beating Greipel may be another thing altogether.

Down Under Classic Unofficial top 10: Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB, Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY, Heinrich Haussler (AUS) - GRM, Jose Joaquin Rojas (ESP) - MOV, Steele von Hoff (AUS - Vic) - UNA, Jonathan Cantwell (AUS) - SAX, Christopher Sutton (AUS) - SKY, Jose Ivan Gutierrez (ESP) - MOV, Gregory Henderson (NZL) - LTB, Alessandro Petacchi (ITA) - LAM.
Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB wins his second Down Under Classic, his previous one was in 2008.
credit to Gregory Henderson (NZL) - LTB and Adam Hansen (AUS) - LTB for their work to drag Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB to the line.
LAP 30/30: Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB WINS easily.
lap 30/30: chaos at the head of the race with Lotto for Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB.
Lotto at the head of the race.
Final lap.
LAP 28/30: GARMIN also in the frame.
LAP 28/30: Teasm SKY overtakes Lotto and go the head of affairs with six riders.
LAP 28/30: the full Lotto train is driving the race.
LAP 27/30: Team Lotto Belisol now controlling the front.
LAP 27/30: Laampre riders working hard now to set up Alessandro Petacchi (ITA) - LAM.
LAP 27/30: lots of changes at the front as the pace is high. pace close to 55kmh.
LAP 26/30: Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB sits in a dnagerous position near the front amd on Gregory Henderson (NZL) - LTB wheel.
LAP 26/30: Job done for Luis Leon Sanchez (ESP) - RAB as Team SAXO BANK come up for air.
LAP 25/30: a first appearance for Team SKY. apologies it was Luis Leon Sanchez (ESP) - RAB leading the race earlier...not #58!
LAP 24/30: #58 is now at the front of the race with lots of Lampre riders around him.
LAP 23/30: Cameron Meyer (AUS) - GEC driving the race now with Simon Gerrans (AUS) - GEC on his wheel.
LAP 23/30: Lotto and GreenEDGE alsom working with RABOBANK.
LAP 23/30: Lots of attacks now with Rabobank driving the peloton.
LAP 20/30: It seems the break has sat up and been absorbed by the peloton. There are four riders off the front now incl Sérgio Paulinho (POR) - SAX
Nathan Haas (AUS) - GRM again won easily and has now picked up 1500 Euros or about $1850 AUS.

Can a GreenEDGE rider win tonight? Here's what defending champ Camerom Meyer said earlier today:

"Gossy likast year was obviously in great nick and this  year might be a little bit behind but I definitely wouldn’t want to be another sprinter up against Matt Goss with 200m to go if he’s on the front cos he’s going to be a red hot chance to win it. "
Prime sprint goes to Nathan Haas (AUS) - GRM a Prime Hattrick!
LAP 20/30: The final prime sprint is at the end of this lap.
LAP 19/30: some of the riders in the break are starting to look over their shoulders.
